Frank

From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailt=
o:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Joanne TaufernerSent: Thursday, Oct=
ober 11, 2007 3:50 PMTo: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comSubject: RE: [EVP-ITC] So i=
s this proof-ative?
 



How much will it cost to fix your little dog?  Cer=
tainly we all can kick in a few bucks to help you; you've been more than ge=
nerous with your sharing of your research  and  boxes.  Give us a figure an=
d maybe some of us will help  Princess.Joanne :^) Frank Sumption <franks-bo=
xes@...> wrote:



 It's not a question of whether or not the break=
 can be set, the question is "How much money do you have?" At this moment--=
I hate this place, and humanity sucks!  Frank




To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.c=
omFrom: bulletbabea@...: Wed, 10 Oct 2007 17:46:56 -0700Subject: =
Re: [EVP-ITC] So is this proof-ative?




A trip to the vet will answer tha=
t question, usually most breaks can be set unless there is another underlyi=
ng problem. It is a cute lil dog, sometimes they are very fragile bone stru=
ctures because of breeding. There are a few small dogs that seem to have al=
ot of problems with bad backs and breaking legs/feet.

 

I think its proof=
 to those who want it, and as for me...nobody is talking about me on the ra=
dio, or using my full name...so it definitely gets my attention when my nam=
e is being used in context with things that are going on around me or happe=
ning to people I know.

 

I dont need any proof, they just give it freely =
so I can share or in some cases not share with everyone.

 

I stopped look=
in for proof right about the time this all started. My first evp was all th=
at I needed to get me on this path. My mothers voice, so long after shes be=
en passed, friends, relatives, or even perfect strangers who I had no clue =
about until I found out after the fact....way too many proofs have been fre=
ely given to me, and I never asked for one. Earl and Bob Cox, I think thats=
 one of my favorite WOW moments, not knowing about Erland Babcock it was an=
 easy misunderstanding. Luckily I make everything phonetic so it was easy t=
o catch later. I have listened to others evp from him since then and I ofte=
n STILL hear earl and bob cox. They have also given me names of workers on =
this side who I have bumped into later tho I usually put off contacting any=
one they mention until I think the time is right. Usually it is just weird =
to find out its a REAL LIVE person and that they just happen to be in the E=
VP/ITC field.

 

I used to always assume when they say a name they are tal=
king about spirits there. Or that if I get an ITC image its a spirit face. =
They proved thats a wrong assumption on several occasions. Probably the onl=
y time I ever asked for anything was while doing an itc session, after so m=
any faces I just wanted them to show me something else, anything else, "sho=
w me something different" led to a few portraits of the living.

 

Sometim=
es they speak the truth, sometimes a wayward thought creeps threw that shou=
ldnt (or just a creep)... as for the dog...take it to the vet and see what =
they can do then you will know more.

 

MistyFrank Sumption <franks-boxes@=
hotmail.com> wrote:



 When you get a voice that talks about a specific si=
tuation, does that prove something is talking that is not a broadcast fragm=
ent? We do have a dog with a broken leg, so it would seem outrageous to sug=
gest the comment received about a dog and a break would be just a stray bro=
adcast. I hate to have an animal suffer, but what a piece of evidence! This=
 is what I mean  by judging content and context.   I don't ask questions, I=
 did not ask about the dog. I was only testing the #24 box, and announced, =
as usuall, that I was doing an EVP recording to test the box.   Frank-S
